messages.content: You are DocIntel, a medical document analysis AI. Extract structured information from clinical documents. Return valid JSON matching the provided schema. Include diagnoses with ICD-10 codes, medications, procedures, lab results, and follow-up recommendations.

You are DocIntel, a medical document analysis AI. Extract structured information from clinical documents. Return valid JSON matching the provided schema. Include diagnoses with ICD-10 codes, medications, procedures, lab results, and follow-up recommendations.

Analyze this medical document and extract structured information:

DISCHARGE SUMMARY
Department: Cardiology
Attending: Dr. Davis
Admission Date: 2022-07-26
Discharge Date: 2022-08-09

Patient is a 47-year-old female admitted for evaluation and management of Cellulitis of lower limb. She presented with symptoms consistent with cellulitis of lower limb and was admitted for further workup.

DIAGNOSES:
Cellulitis of lower limb, Diabetic Nephropathy, Acute Appendicitis, Hypothyroidism

HOSPITAL COURSE:
The patient was admitted and started on appropriate therapy. She underwent the following evaluations:
  - Bone marrow biopsy: Mild abnormality noted, recommend follow-up
  - MRI of lumbar spine: No evidence of obstruction or mass
  - Colonoscopy: No acute fracture or dislocation

LABORATORY RESULTS:
  - D-Dimer: 190 ng/mL (normal)
  - INR: 0.3 ratio (critical)
  - Platelet Count: 569 x10^3/uL (high)
  - BNP: 0 pg/mL (low)
  - Lactate: 1.0 mmol/L (normal)
  - Chloride: 99.7 mEq/L (normal)
  - HbA1c: 0.9 % (critical)
  - BUN: 24.0 mg/dL (high)

MEDICATIONS AT DISCHARGE:
  - Furosemide 40mg once daily (oral)
  - Atorvastatin 40mg once daily at bedtime (oral)
  - Morphine 2mg every 4 hours as needed (IV)
  - Aspirin 81mg once daily (oral)

FOLLOW-UP PLAN:
  - Post-operative follow-up with Gastroenterology in 2 months
  - Follow-up imaging study with Cardiology in 6 months
  - Follow-up with primary care physician with Pulmonology in 2 weeks

The patient was discharged in stable condition after a 14-day stay. She was counseled on medication compliance and return precautions.

Analyze this medical document and extract structured information:

DISCHARGE SUMMARY
Department: Hematology
Attending: Dr. Thomas
Admission Date: 2025-12-16
Discharge Date: 2025-12-25

Patient is a 51-year-old male admitted for evaluation and management of Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus. He presented with symptoms consistent with type 2 diabetes mellitus and was admitted for further workup.

DIAGNOSES:
Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus, Acute Kidney Injury, Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease, Iron Deficiency Anemia

HOSPITAL COURSE:
The patient was admitted and started on appropriate therapy. He underwent the following evaluations:
  - Echocardiogram: No acute fracture or dislocation

LABORATORY RESULTS:
  - Potassium: 3.9 mEq/L (normal)
  - White Blood Cell Count: 9.6 x10^3/uL (normal)
  - Glucose: 49.2 mg/dL (low)
  - ALT: 60.3 U/L (high)
  - Lactate: 0.2 mmol/L (critical)
  - CRP: 0.0 mg/L (low)

MEDICATIONS AT DISCHARGE:
  - Metformin 1000mg twice daily (oral)
  - Enoxaparin 40mg once daily (subcutaneous)
  - Furosemide 40mg once daily (oral)
  - Ciprofloxacin 500mg twice daily (oral)
  - Azithromycin 250mg once daily (oral)
  - Amlodipine 5mg once daily (oral)

FOLLOW-UP PLAN:
  - Referral to specialist with Pulmonology in 6 weeks
  - Repeat lab work with Primary Care in 3 months
  - Cardiac rehabilitation evaluation with Gastroenterology in 1 month

The patient was discharged in stable condition after a 9-day stay. He was counseled on medication compliance and return precautions.

OBJECTIVE:

PLAN:
